headline.main: Out of Cookies and Onto Labels: Bad Fat Steps Into the Daylight

byline.original: By KIM SEVERSON; Melanie Warner contributed reporting for this article

docs.lead_paragraph: THE Girl Scouts' most popular cookie, the Thin Mint, will make its trans fat-free debut this year. So will Orville Redenbacher microwave popcorn, one of 120 products ConAgra is reformulating to reduce or eliminate trans fat. Kraft, maker of the Oreo cookie, announced earlier this month that it had succeeded in reducing or removing trans fat from 650 of its products.
docs.snippet: With trans fat grams out in the open, companies are making them disappear. But food activists say that despite the changes, plenty of the fat still exists.

keywords.value: CENTER FOR SCIENCE IN THE PUBLIC INTEREST
